body: • An editorial about the forthcoming EU referendum said Boris Johnson and Nigel Farage were “chugging around Britain” in their bright red Vote Leave campaign battlebus. Farage is not part of the Vote Leave campaign; he is touring the UK in Ukip’s deep purple battlebus (This campaign must show more respect for both facts and voters, 28 May, page 34). • The caption with a photograph on the letters page (17 May, page 28), which showed a tiny woman walking between rows of large chairs, should have made clear that the photograph had been digitally manipulated. There was no intention to mislead on the part of the photographer. • A feature about the rapper Stormzy (Taking the world by storm, 21 May, page 8, The Guide) said: “One month he’ll be giving a talk at the Oxford union; the next hanging out in Ayia Napa with a guy who’s got ‘Stormzy’ tattooed on his bum.” We got the location of the tattoo-related incident correct, but the talk by Stormzy that the article referred to was at the Oxford Guild Business Society, not at the Oxford Union.
